page.title: 05TRAIN DRIVER
page.content:
The times and routes of the day are given to the driver in a wallet when he clocks on. Ten minutes are given to book in and read notices relating to track repairs or diversions. Diesel trains are checked for fuel, water, air and oil pressure and oil leaks; electric trains have brakes and couplings tested. Drivers change types and routes regularly.
Good drivers have an intelligent and responsible attitude coupled with good health. They begin training at eighteen, qualifying at twenty-one. During his training he is an engine cleaner and fireman and when qualified earns an average of Â£121 per week plus free rail passes.
